arm_group.arm_group_label: Diagnosis with Gout and use of colchicine

brief_summary.textblock:
Measure if FDA regulation of Colchicne in 2009 has resulted in safer use in clinical
      settings.

      Our study will assess the impact of this Initiative on colchicine use and will provide data
      that supports its continuation and expansion.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Unapproved Drug Initiative on Colchicine Use

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Clinical diagnosis of gout

          -  Current use of colchicine/colcrys to treat gout

          -  Ablility to provide Informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -Inability to provide Informed consent

study_pop.textblock:
All adults diagnosed with gout. Patient's from Stanford hospital and clinics and VA Palo
        Alto Heath care system are eligible

clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Unapproved Drug Initiative on Colchicine Use

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: We expect to understand the impact of regulatory approach to colchicine preparation and how marketing can affect clinical use patterns in the real world.
primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of use of colchicine in an unapproved fashion in contemporary medical proactice.
primary_outcome.time_frame: This is an oberservational study and patients will be followed for upto 2 years from enrollment.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
